wikipedia_page.main: William Findlay Weir (18 April 1889 – 9 July 1918) was a Scottish professional footballer who played as a wing half for The Wednesday and Tottenham Hotspur in the Football League.

response: Among the volunteers who joined the Tottenham Royal Engineers were Tottenham Hotspur F.C. footballers Billy Minter and Findlay Weir. Both became serjeants; Minter was wounded and awarded the Meritorious Service Medal, while Weir was killed in action with the unit on 9 July 1918.Minter at Lives of the First World War.Weir at Lives of the First World War.Weir factfile at MEHSTG.
